intro: Pyrola elata, commonly known as the white wintergreen, is a low-growing evergreen perennial native to the northern forests of North America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, commonly known as the heath family, and is characterized by its dark green, leathery leaves. The plant produces small, bell-shaped white flowers in late spring to early summer. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded, moist environments. Pyrola elata is a hardy plant that can survive harsh winter conditions due to its waxy leaf coating.
